question.text: Mark the correct statement/s about arithmetic growth.

options.text: In mitosis, only one daughter cell continues to divide while the other differentiates and matures.
The simplest expression of this growth is exemplified by a root elongating at a constant rate.

solution.text:
In arithmetic growth, following mitotic cell division, only one daughter cell continues to divide while the other differentiates and matures. The simplest expression of arithmetic growth is exemplified by a root elongating at a constant rate. Look at Figure 15.5. On plotting the length of the organ against time, a linear curve is obtained. Mathematically, it is expressed as
Lt = L0 + rt
Lt = length at time ‘t’
L0 = length at time ‘zero’
r = growth rate / elongation per unit time.
